thread.title: Twitter is having a grand old time with Trump's unfinished sentence
thread.title_full: Twitter is having a grand old time with Trump's unfinished sentence

author: Chloe Bryan
title: Twitter is having a grand old time with Trump's unfinished sentence
text:
Donald Trump has so very much to tweet that sometimes, he needs multiple tweets to get his point across. And he loves a long, suspenseful ellipsis.
But on Wednesday, Trump forgot one of the key facets of tweet-splitting. After the ellipsis, you gotta remember to post the rest of your thoughts.
SEE ALSO: 6 ways to push your online activism into the real world in the Trump era
I will be speaking at 9:00 A.M. today to Police Chiefs and Sheriffs and will be discussing the horrible, dangerous and wrong decision
— Donald J. Trump (@realDonaldTrump) February 8, 2017
Which is why Twitter is having so much fun completing this lonely little tweet. Turns out, the internet has a few opinions about what "horrible, dangerous and wrong decision[s]" have come to pass in the Trump era. Imagine!
@realDonaldTrump ...to confirm DeVos?
— Mike Denison (@mikd33) February 8, 2017
@JordanUhl @mikd33 ...to run for president
— Matt Haig (@matthaig1) February 8, 2017
@realDonaldTrump the horrible wrong decision to have allowed you to take the oath and become president?
— Cole Ledford (@ColeLedford11) February 8, 2017
. @mikd33 to silence Senator Warren
— Jordan Uhl (@JordanUhl) February 8, 2017
. @realDonaldTrump "...to make me president and confirm any of my Cabinet picks."
— Jessie (@NicCageMatch) February 8, 2017
Trump did indeed address a coalition of top police officials Wednesday morning. He did not say the phrase "horrible, dangerous and wrong decision," but we imagine that tweet might've have something to do with federal judge James Robart's decision to block his immigration ban.
BONUS: Sean Spicer just cannot get the Prime Minister of Australia's name right
